question: Identify cyber security threat not a type of malware.
answer: Phishing

question: Identify another example of malware.
answer:
Any one from:
• Spyware // Keylogger
• Adware
• Trojan horse

question: Identify software used to find and remove malware.
answer: Anti-malware

Convert binary 11100011 to hexadecimal.

E3

question: Define clock speed.
answer: The maximum number of FDE cycles/instructions a CPU can perform/process/execute in a second

question: Explain effect of changing CPU from 2 GHz to 3 GHz.
answer:
Increases/improves the performance // Tasks can be performed quicker/faster
… because more FDE cycles/instructions can be processed in a second

question: Describe MAR role in FDE cycle.
answer:
Stores addresses …
… of next instruction/data to be fetched // where data is to be written to

question: State name of list of machine code commands CPU can process.
answer: Instruction set

question: Give two characteristics of embedded system.
answer:
Any two from:
• Performs a single/limited/dedicated function/task
• It has a microprocessor
• It has dedicated hardware
• Uses firmware
• It is normally built into a larger device/system
• User normally cannot reprogram
• It does not require much power
• It is cheap to manufacture
• Works automatically // works without human intervention
• It is small (in size)
• It is a real-time system

question: Circle three other examples of embedded system.
answer:
One mark for each correct system:
• security light system
• freezer
• vending machine

question: Give one benefit of higher sample rate for sound recording.
answer:
Any one from:
• The recording of the song is more accurate/closer to original

question: Give one drawback of higher sample rate.
answer:
Any one from:
• The file size will be increased
• The file will require more storage space

question: Define sample resolution.
answer:
Any two from:
• The number of bits that are used per sample
• … that provides the variation in amplitude that can be stored for each sample // defines the number of different amplitudes that can be recorded
• … that determines how quiet/loud the sounds are that can be recorded
• Example e.g. 16-bit

question: Identify compression method that doesn't permanently remove data.
answer: Lossless

question: Complete table about data transmission methods.
answer:
One mark for each correct data transmission method:
data transmission method
serial simplex
parallel half-duplex
serial full-duplex
parallel simplex

question: Identify two input devices for automatic ticket reading.
answer:
Any two from e.g.
• Barcode scanner
• QR code scanner
• Digital camera

question: Explain how sensor and microprocessor check train door closure.
answer:
Any six from:
• Proximity/infrared/pressure sensor used
• Sensor continually sends digitised data to microprocessor // When driver pushes button, sensor sends digitised data to the microprocessor
• Microprocessor compares data to stored value(s)
• If in range/out of range/matches, microprocessor sends signal to close the door
• Actuator used to close door
• If not in range/out of range/does not match door will not close // If not in range/out of range/does not match actuator not activated/signal not sent as passenger in door // If not in range/out of range/does not match a timer is set to check again // If not in range/out of range/does not match a signal is sent to alert the driver/output a message
• This process repeats until the door can close

question: Identify security solution against data interception.
answer:
Encryption …
… if the data is intercepted it will be meaningless (because they do not have the decryption key)

question: Complete table about internet terms.
answer:
Term
world wide web
cookie
uniform resource locator (URL)
web server
hypertext markup language // HTML
hypertext transfer protocol // HTTP

question: State one main characteristic of AI system.
answer:
Any one from:
• The ability to learn/adapt // machine learning abilities
• The collection of data and the rules for using that data
• The ability to reason // has problem solving abilities // makes predictions
• Simulates intelligent/human behaviour
• Analyses patterns

question: Explain how expert system operates.
answer:
Any six from:
• It has an interface …
• … used to input data/view output
• It has a knowledge base
• It has a rule base
• It has an inference engine
• Applies the rule base to/and the knowledge base to provide output/diagnosis/result/solution/decision
• Decides what to ask next based on the data input

question: Identify what flow sensor measures.
answer: Amount of liquid/gas/steam flowing/moving through an environment

question: Explain one advantage of automated system for employees.
answer:
Two from (for benefit and matching description) e.g.:
• Increases safety
• …meaning that workers do not need to go into dangerous areas to collect data/make checks/do dangerous tasks
• Can increase jobs/skills
• …as employees are needed to learn/maintain the equipment
• No need to do repetitive tasks
• … so, they can use their time on other/more skilled tasks

question: Explain one disadvantage of automated system for owners.
answer:
Two from (for drawback and matching description) e.g.:
• High set-up/installation costs
• … it would mean the company need to find a lot of money up front to pay for the equipment // employees will need training
• Utility/maintenance/repair costs
• … increase in bills such as electricity // skilled employees will be required to maintain the system // equipment will break/need updating
• Deskilling of the workforce
• … may mean that workers will no longer have the skills for some of the manufacturing jobs, should the equipment break

question: Give two other features of digital currency.
answer:
Any two from:
• Only exists electronically
• Can be a decentralised system
• Can be a centralised system
• Usually encrypted

question: Identify process using digital ledger to track digital currency.
answer: Blockchain

question: Identify example of primary storage.
answer: Random access memory (RAM)

question: Give one characteristic of primary storage.
answer:
Any one from:
• Directly accessed by the CPU
• Has both volatile and non-volatile storage

question: Complete description about virtual memory.
answer:
One mark for each correct term in the correct order:
• Random access memory (RAM)
• Hard disk drive (HDD)
• Pages
• Random access memory (RAM)
• Virtual memory // Hard disk drive (HDD)
